content: Singaporean judge (born 1954) Justice **Lee Seiu Kin** ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 李兆坚; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Lǐ Zhàojiān*) is a Senior Judge of the [Supreme Court of Singapore](/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_Singapore). ## Early life and education Born in [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia) in 1954, Lee was educated in Malaysia and [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). He then studied engineering at the [University of Adelaide](/wiki/University_of_Adelaide), graduating with an honours degree in 1977 and worked as a civil engineer for a few years, before obtaining a Masters of Science (Construction Engineering) from the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore) in 1982. He obtained an MBA(Distinction) from [INSEAD](/wiki/INSEAD), at Fontainebleau, France in 1983. He then studied law at the National University of Singapore, graduating in 1986 with an LLB(Hons). He subsequently obtained a [Masters of Law](/wiki/Master_of_Laws) from the [University of Cambridge](/wiki/University_of_Cambridge) in 1987. ## Career Upon graduating from law school, Lee served in various capacities in the Attorney-General's Chambers before he was first appointed as [Judicial Commissioner](/wiki/Judicial_commissioner) of the [Supreme Court of Singapore](/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_Singapore) on 15 October 1997. He subsequently returned to the [Attorney-General's Chambers](/wiki/Attorney-General%27s_Chambers) as Second [Solicitor-General](/wiki/Solicitor_general), before returning to the [Supreme Court of Singapore](/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_Singapore) as a Judge in 2006. On 31 January 2024, [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore) [Tharman Shanmugaratnam](/wiki/Tharman_Shanmugaratnam) appointed Lee as Senior Judge of the Supreme Court. Lee is presently a Resident in The Arbitration Chambers where he practises as an arbitrator and mediator. This Singapore law-related biographical article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Lee Seiu Kin
